moves.1. d4:
Another annotation from my QGD Slav exchange tournament.

This was an enjoyable game which was hard fought right to the end.

Please feel free to comment, I hope you enjoy this game as much as I did
moves.4. Nf3 Nf6 5. e3 Bf5 6. Bd3 Bxd3 7. Qxd3: Black is still a few moves from castling, so I try to take advantage
moves.8... e6 9. Qb5 Qc7: a nice move from black giving the queen a good line to h2
moves.10. Ne5: Still trying to maintain pressure to prevent castling
moves.10... Bd6: Black of course isn't falling for it and develops his dsb
moves.11. Nd2: Black won't take the knight as then he will be forced to move his own knight, this gives me the opportunity to support my knight
moves.11... O-O: Removes the pin on the knight meaning it is now threatening the knight on e5
moves.12. Ndf3: Maintaining pressure, the white knights are not easy to extricate from here and are useful as they close the diagonal for blacks dsb and queen
moves.12... a6 13. Qe2: My queen was serving no useful purpose where it was so I relocate
moves.13... h6: prevents Ng5 however this also weakens the pawns around the black king
moves.14. a3 Ne4: preparing to shift the white knight on e5
moves.15. Bd2: If black is going to move my knight I want to try to make sure that his dsb is no longer available
moves.15... a5 16. Rac1 f6 17. Ng6: This knight is going to remain an annoyance to black, it is not easy to extricate from here, however I have other plans for it. It also forces the rook to move.
moves.17... Rfe8 18. Nf4 Qf7: Prevents Nh5, however raises the tempting possibility of a fork by getting a knight to d6
moves.19. Nh4 Ne7 20. Be1: preparing to shift the knight on e4
moves.20... e5 21. Nh5 Ng6 22. f3: Trying to remove one of the defenders of d6
moves.23... Bf8 24. b4: Still trying to remove the black dsb from the f8-a3 diagonal - if axb4, then Bxb4 forces the bishop exchange
moves.24... Ne7: The fork on d6 is less of a threat now as I would lose 2 knight for a rook
moves.25. Nhxg7: I think this was a mistake on my part. I was trying to open up the position around the black king with a view to possibly bringing my dsb into the attack
moves.25... Bxg7: I'm not sure if this is a mistake or not - and would certainly appreciate any comments, black accepts the fork with the compensation that his pawns around the king are strengthened
moves.26... Qg6: Black now has the threat of Nh3+
moves.27. Nxe8 Rxe8 28. Kh1: I'm quite sure at this point black was relieved to be rid of my knights
moves.28... Nf5: Preparing more troops for an assault
moves.29. Bf2 Bf8 30. Rc7: I decide to go for a counter attack on the queen's side. My rook is here partly to scare black but also to keep the black king restricted
This was to try to keep the black king hemmed in but I am not sure if Qa5 might have been better
moves.36... exd4 37. e4: Trying to avoid an isolated pawn and also slightly improving the position of my dsb
moves.40. Bg1: Trying to avoid opening the position around my king too much
moves.40... Nd2 41. Bb6: Would Rd1 have been better here?
moves.41... Rc8 42. Qd7 Nxb1 43. Bc5: This is surely a mistake, Qxc8+ would be better
moves.43... Re8 44. Qxd6+ Kg8 45. e5: Clearly black can't take the pawn
moves.45... Ne4: Threatening my dsb, I need it on the g1a7 diagonal to resist some of blacks threats
moves.49... Ng3+ 50. Kg1 Nce2+: At this point I thought black was going for a draw, he however has something else in mind
moves.54... Neg3+:
And white is lost after Kg1 qd4#

Thanks for reading
